metadata.description: Log analytics workspace for diagnostic logs. (Default: "")
Details about the application.
Application Security Group (ASG) for the session hosts. (Default: "")
Availability set resource ID. (Default: "")
Source custom image ID. (Default: "")
Subscription ID where to deploy session hosts. (Default: )
Resource Group name where to deploy session hosts. (Default: )
Quantity of session hosts to deploy. (Default: 1)
The session host number to begin with for the deployment. (Default: )
AVD resources custom naming. (Default: false)
Required, Eronll session hosts on Intune. (Default: false)
Deploy Fslogix setup. (Default: false)
Apply tags on resources and resource groups. (Default: false)
Cost center of owner team. (Default: Contoso-CC)
AVD disk encryption set resource ID to enable server side encyption. (Default: "")
Department that owns the deployment, (Dafult: Contoso-AVD)
Sensitivity of data hosted (Default: Non-business)
Enables a zero trust configuration on the session host disks. (Default: false)
Deploy AVD monitoring resources and setings. (Default: false)
The name of the resource group to deploy. (Default: Dev)
The name of the resource group to deploy. (Default: AVD1)
AVD session host domain join user principal name. (Default: NoUsername)
OS disk type for session host. (Default: Standard_LRS)
Domain join user password keyvault secret name. (Default: domainJoinUserPassword)
Enables accelerated Networking on the session hosts. (Default: true)
FSLogix storage resource ID. (Default: )
FSLogix file share name. (Default: )
AVD Host Pool resource ID. (Default: )
FQDN of on-premises AD domain, used for FSLogix storage configuration and NTFS setup. (Default: "")
AVD subnet name. (Default: )
Location where to deploy compute services. (Default: )
AVD session host prefix custom name. (Default: vmapp1duse2)
Creates an availability zone and adds the VMs to it. Cannot be used in combination with availability set nor scale set. (Default: true)
The service providing domain services for Azure Virtual Desktop. (Default: ADDS)
Session host VM size. (Default: Standard_D4ads_v5)
Specifies the securityType of the virtual machine. "ConfidentialVM" and "TrustedLaunch" require a Gen2 Image. (Default: TrustedLaunch)

Specifies whether secure boot should be enabled on the virtual machine. This parameter is part of the UefiSettings. securityType should be set to TrustedLaunch or ConfidentialVM to enable UefiSettings. (Default: true)

Specifies whether vTPM should be enabled on the virtual machine. This parameter is part of the UefiSettings. securityType should be set to TrustedLaunch or ConfidentialVM to enable UefiSettings. (Default: true)
Set to deploy image from Azure Compute Gallery. (Default: false)
VM local administrator username. (Default: )
Resource ID of keyvault that contains credentials. (Default: )
VM local admin keyvault secret name. (Default: )
OU path to join AVd VMs. (Default: "")
AVD OS image SKU. (Default: win11-21h2)
Do not modify, used to set unique value for resource deployment.
The name of workload for tagging purposes. (Default: Contoso-Workload)
Reference to the size of the VM for your workloads (Default: Light)
Criticality of the workload. (Default: Low)
Tag value for custom criticality value. (Default: Contoso-Critical)
Service level agreement level of the worload. (Contoso-SLA)
Team accountable for day-to-day operations. (workload-admins@Contoso.com)
Organizational owner of the AVD deployment. (Default: workload-owner@Contoso.com)

variables.varCustomResourceTags: [if(parameters('createResourceTags'), createObject('WorkloadName', parameters('workloadNameTag'), 'WorkloadType', parameters('workloadTypeTag'), 'DataClassification', parameters('dataClassificationTag'), 'Department', parameters('departmentTag'), 'Criticality', if(equals(parameters('workloadCriticalityTag'), 'Custom'), parameters('workloadCriticalityCustomValueTag'), parameters('workloadCriticalityTag')), 'ApplicationName', parameters('applicationNameTag'), 'ServiceClass', parameters('workloadSlaTag'), 'OpsTeam', parameters('opsTeamTag'), 'Owner', parameters('ownerTag'), 'CostCenter', parameters('costCenterTag')), createObject())]

value.ipConfigurations: [if(not(empty(parameters('asgResourceId'))), createArray(createObject('name', 'ipconfig01', 'subnetResourceId', parameters('subnetResourceId'), 'applicationSecurityGroups', createArray(createObject('id', parameters('asgResourceId'))))), createArray(createObject('name', 'ipconfig01', 'subnetResourceId', parameters('subnetResourceId'))))]

parameters.extensionDomainJoinPassword: [if(or(equals(parameters('identityServiceProvider'), 'ADDS'), equals(parameters('identityServiceProvider'), 'AADDS')), createObject('reference', createObject('keyVault', createObject('id', extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', format('{0}', variables('varKeyVaultSubId')), format('{0}', variables('varKeyVaultRgName'))), 'Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults', variables('varKeyVaultName'))), 'secretName', parameters('domainJoinPasswordSecretName'))), createObject('value', 'domainJoinUserPassword'))]

metadata.description: Optional. The name of the virtual machine to be created. You should use a unique prefix to reduce name collisions in Active Directory. If no value is provided, a 10 character long unique string will be generated based on the Resource Group's name.

Optional. Specifies whether the computer names should be transformed. The transformation is performed on all computer names. Available transformations are 'none' (Default), 'uppercase' and 'lowercase'.
Required. Specifies the size for the VMs.

Optional. This property can be used by user in the request to enable or disable the Host Encryption for the virtual machine. This will enable the encryption for all the disks including Resource/Temp disk at host itself. For security reasons, it is recommended to set encryptionAtHost to True. Restrictions: Cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VMs.
Optional. Specifies the SecurityType of the virtual machine. It is set as TrustedLaunch to enable UefiSettings.
Optional. Specifies whether secure boot should be enabled on the virtual machine. This parameter is part of the UefiSettings. SecurityType should be set to TrustedLaunch to enable UefiSettings.
Optional. Specifies whether vTPM should be enabled on the virtual machine. This parameter is part of the UefiSettings.  SecurityType should be set to TrustedLaunch to enable UefiSettings.
Required. OS image reference. In case of marketplace images, it's the combination of the publisher, offer, sku, version attributes. In case of custom images it's the resource ID of the custom image.

Optional. Specifies information about the marketplace image used to create the virtual machine. This element is only used for marketplace images. Before you can use a marketplace image from an API, you must enable the image for programmatic use.

Required. Specifies the OS disk. For security reasons, it is recommended to specify DiskEncryptionSet into the osDisk object.  Restrictions: DiskEncryptionSet cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VMs.

Optional. Specifies the data disks. For security reasons, it is recommended to specify DiskEncryptionSet into the dataDisk object. Restrictions: DiskEncryptionSet cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VMs.

Optional. The flag that enables or disables a capability to have one or more managed data disks with UltraSSD_LRS storage account type on the VM or VMSS. Managed disks with storage account type UltraSSD_LRS can be added to a virtual machine or virtual machine scale set only if this property is enabled.
Required. Administrator username.
Optional. When specifying a Windows Virtual Machine, this value should be passed.
Optional. Custom data associated to the VM, this value will be automatically converted into base64 to account for the expected VM format.
Optional. Specifies set of certificates that should be installed onto the virtual machine.
Optional. Specifies the priority for the virtual machine.
Optional. Specifies the eviction policy for the low priority virtual machine. Will result in 'Deallocate' eviction policy.
Optional. Specifies the maximum price you are willing to pay for a low priority VM/VMSS. This price is in US Dollars.
Optional. Specifies resource ID about the dedicated host that the virtual machine resides in.
Optional. Specifies that the image or disk that is being used was licensed on-premises. This element is only used for images that contain the Windows Server operating system.
Optional. The list of SSH public keys used to authenticate with linux based VMs.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource. The system-assigned managed identity will automatically be enabled if extensionAadJoinConfig.enabled = "True".
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.

Optional. Whether boot diagnostics should be enabled on the Virtual Machine. Boot diagnostics will be enabled with a managed storage account if no bootDiagnosticsStorageAccountName value is provided. If bootDiagnostics and bootDiagnosticsStorageAccountName values are not provided, boot diagnostics will be disabled.
Optional. Custom storage account used to store boot diagnostic information. Boot diagnostics will be enabled with a custom storage account if a value is provided.
Optional. Storage account boot diagnostic base URI.
Optional. Resource ID of a proximity placement group.
Optional. Resource ID of an availability set. Cannot be used in combination with availability zone nor scale set.

Optional. If set to 1, 2 or 3, the availability zone for all VMs is hardcoded to that value. If zero, then availability zones is not used. Cannot be used in combination with availability set nor scale set.
Required. Configures NICs and PIPs.
Optional. The name of the PIP diagnostic setting, if deployed.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the NIC diagnostic setting, if deployed.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. Recovery service vault name to add VMs to backup.
Optional. Resource group of the backup recovery service vault. If not provided the current resource group name is considered by default.
Optional. Backup policy the VMs should be using for backup. If not provided, it will use the DefaultPolicy from the backup recovery service vault.
Optional. Specifies whether extension operations should be allowed on the virtual machine. This may only be set to False when no extensions are present on the virtual machine.
Optional. Required if name is specified. Password of the user specified in user parameter.
Optional. The configuration for the [Domain Join] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [AAD Join] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Anti Malware] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Monitoring Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. Resource ID of the monitoring log analytics workspace. Must be set when extensionMonitoringAgentConfig is set to true.
Optional. The configuration for the [Dependency Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Network Watcher Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.

Optional. The configuration for the [Azure Disk Encryption] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed. Restrictions: Cannot be enabled on disks that have encryption at host enabled. Managed disks encrypted using Azure Disk Encryption cannot be encrypted using customer-managed keys.
Optional. The configuration for the [Desired State Configuration] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Custom Script] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific protected settings.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Generated. Do not provide a value! This date value is used to generate a registration token.

Optional. SAS token validity length to use to download files from storage accounts. Usage: 'PT8H' - valid for 8 hours; 'P5D' - valid for 5 days; 'P1Y' - valid for 1 year. When not provided, the SAS token will be valid for 8 hours.
Required. The chosen OS type.
Optional. Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled.

Optional. Indicates whether virtual machine agent should be provisioned on the virtual machine. When this property is not specified in the request body, default behavior is to set it to true. This will ensure that VM Agent is installed on the VM so that extensions can be added to the VM later.

Optional. Indicates whether Automatic Updates is enabled for the Windows virtual machine. Default value is true. When patchMode is set to Manual, this parameter must be set to false. For virtual machine scale sets, this property can be updated and updates will take effect on OS reprovisioning.

Optional. VM guest patching orchestration mode. 'AutomaticByOS' & 'Manual' are for Windows only, 'ImageDefault' for Linux only. Refer to 'https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/automatic-vm-guest-patching'.
Optional. VM guest patching assessment mode. Set it to 'AutomaticByPlatform' to enable automatically check for updates every 24 hours.
Optional. Specifies the time zone of the virtual machine. e.g. 'Pacific Standard Time'. Possible values can be `TimeZoneInfo.id` value from time zones returned by `TimeZoneInfo.GetSystemTimeZones`.
Optional. Specifies additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup. - AdditionalUnattendContent object.
Optional. Specifies the Windows Remote Management listeners. This enables remote Windows PowerShell. - WinRMConfiguration object.
Required. The configuration profile of automanage.

linuxConfiguration.patchSettings: [if(and(parameters('provisionVMAgent'), or(equals(toLower(parameters('patchMode')), toLower('AutomaticByPlatform')), equals(toLower(parameters('patchMode')), toLower('ImageDefault')))), createObject('patchMode', parameters('patchMode'), 'assessmentMode', parameters('patchAssessmentMode')), null())]

windowsConfiguration.patchSettings: [if(and(parameters('provisionVMAgent'), or(or(equals(toLower(parameters('patchMode')), toLower('AutomaticByPlatform')), equals(toLower(parameters('patchMode')), toLower('AutomaticByOS'))), equals(toLower(parameters('patchMode')), toLower('Manual')))), createObject('patchMode', parameters('patchMode'), 'assessmentMode', parameters('patchAssessmentMode')), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Optional. The network security group (NSG) to attach to the network interface.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. The name of the PIP diagnostic setting, if deployed.
Optional. The name of the NIC diagnostic setting, if deployed.
Required. The name of the Public IP Address.
Optional. Resource ID of the Public IP Prefix object. This is only needed if you want your Public IPs created in a PIP Prefix.
Optional. The public IP address allocation method.
Optional. Name of a public IP address SKU.
Optional. Tier of a public IP address SKU.
Optional. A list of availability zones denoting the IP allocated for the resource needs to come from.
Optional. IP address version.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.

Optional. The domain name label. The concatenation of the domain name label and the regionalized DNS zone make up the fully qualified domain name associated with the public IP address. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.
Optional. The Fully Qualified Domain Name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.

Optional. The reverse FQDN. A user-visible, fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Location for all resources.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed. If left empty, it defaults to "<resourceName>-diagnosticSettings".

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
The resource group the public IP address was deployed into.
The name of the public IP address.
The resource ID of the public IP address.
The public IP address of the public IP address resource.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.description: Required. The name of the network interface.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Optional. Indicates whether IP forwarding is enabled on this network interface.
Optional. If the network interface is accelerated networking enabled.

Optional. List of DNS servers IP addresses. Use 'AzureProvidedDNS' to switch to azure provided DNS resolution. 'AzureProvidedDNS' value cannot be combined with other IPs, it must be the only value in dnsServers collection.
Optional. The network security group (NSG) to attach to the network interface.
Optional. Auxiliary mode of Network Interface resource. Not all regions are enabled for Auxiliary Mode Nic.
Optional. Indicates whether to disable tcp state tracking. Subscription must be registered for the Microsoft.Network/AllowDisableTcpStateTracking feature before this property can be set to true.
Required. A list of IPConfigurations of the network interface.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource identifier of log analytics.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed. If left empty, it defaults to "<resourceName>-diagnosticSettings".

Conditional. The name of the parent virtual machine that extension is provisioned for. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the virtual machine extension.
Optional. The location the extension is deployed to.
Required. The name of the extension handler publisher.
Required. Specifies the type of the extension; an example is "CustomScriptExtension".
Required. Specifies the version of the script handler.

Required. Indicates whether the extension should use a newer minor version if one is available at deployment time. Once deployed, however, the extension will not upgrade minor versions unless redeployed, even with this property set to true.
Optional. How the extension handler should be forced to update even if the extension configuration has not changed.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific settings.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific protected settings.

Optional. Indicates whether failures stemming from the extension will be suppressed (Operational failures such as not connecting to the VM will not be suppressed regardless of this value). The default is false.
Required. Indicates whether the extension should be automatically upgraded by the platform if there is a newer version of the extension available.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

Required. Indicates whether the extension should use a newer minor version if one is available at deployment time. Once deployed, however, the extension will not upgrade minor versions unless redeployed, even with this property set to true.
Optional. How the extension handler should be forced to update even if the extension configuration has not changed.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific settings.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific protected settings.

Optional. Indicates whether failures stemming from the extension will be suppressed (Operational failures such as not connecting to the VM will not be suppressed regardless of this value). The default is false.
Required. Indicates whether the extension should be automatically upgraded by the platform if there is a newer version of the extension available.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
